item.title: I'm So Meta Even This Acronym...
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney

item.title: A guided tour of Python logging
item.description:
Description

Logging is a tremendously powerful tool in monitoring and debugging, but many people avoid it in Python, feeling it's too complex. Come with me as we explore what's going on, and hopefully become better friends with this wonderful part of stdlib.
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney

item.title: PostgreSQL Indexing : How, why, and when.
item.description:
Description

So many of the things we build depend on a DBMS to keep our data safe, and retrieve it quickly. We know indexes can make that faster, but... how do they work? When should you use them? What should I index?
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney

item.title: A quick intro to AWS Serverless
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney

item.title: A state of REST.
item.description:
Summary

In the Django world there are currently two major REST API libraries, with a new one starting to take hold.

But how do you choose?

In this talk I plan to give details on how these three apps (TastyPie, Django REST Framework, and django-nap) differ, as well as overlap.
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney

item.title: Django MiniConf: How to be helped; or, Why is FunkyBob angry with me?
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney

item.title: Core Team Panel, featuring: Chris Beaven, Markus Holterman, Russell Keith-Magee, Curtis Maloney
item.dc:creator: Chris Beaven

item.title: To AST and Beyond
item.description:
Description

Follow my journey of building a super fast templating engine which turns your markup into Python code through AST.

Uncover the power available in Python's Abstract Syntax Tree module for building and manipulating code ... in your code!
item.dc:creator: Curtis Maloney
